remarks: Deduce the identity element of a group from its properties.  Useful in conjunction with ~ isgrpd .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)
statement:
grpidd2.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
grpidd2.p $e |- ( ph -> .+ = ( +g ` G ) ) $.
grpidd2.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. e. B ) $.
grpidd2.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( .0. .+ x ) = x ) $.
grpidd2.j $e |- ( ph -> G e. Grp ) $.
grpidd2 $p |- ( ph -> .0. = ( 0g ` G ) ) $.
$d .+ x $.
$d .0. x $.
$d B x $.
$d ph x $.
